tasks.title: Phase 1: Core Graph Infrastructure
tasks.description: Implement the foundational graph infrastructure including port type system, node types, connection types with compile-time validation, and basic graph structure.
tasks.details: This phase establishes the type-safe foundation for the graph API. It includes port type system using tuples, node types (ProducerNode, TransformerNode, ConsumerNode), connection types with compile-time validation, and basic graph structure.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests for each component, property-based tests for type validation

subtasks.title: Port type system
subtasks.description: Implement type-level port lists using tuples (e.g., Node<Inputs = (I1, I2), Outputs = (O1, O2)>)

subtasks.title: Node types (ProducerNode, TransformerNode, ConsumerNode)
subtasks.description: Create node types that wrap existing Producer, Transformer, and Consumer traits with port information

subtasks.title: Connection types with compile-time validation
subtasks.description: Implement connection types that validate port compatibility at compile time using trait bounds

subtasks.title: Basic graph structure
subtasks.description: Create Graph struct that holds nodes and connections, with methods for querying topology

tasks.title: Phase 2: Router System
tasks.description: Implement the router system including InputRouter and OutputRouter traits, and router implementations (RoundRobin, Broadcast, KeyBased, Merge).
tasks.details: This phase implements the router system as specified in GRAPH.md. Routers enable fan-out and fan-in patterns in the graph, allowing multiple inputs/outputs per node.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests for each router type, integration tests for router behavior in graphs

subtasks.title: InputRouter trait
subtasks.description: Define InputRouter trait for routing multiple input streams to a single node

subtasks.title: OutputRouter trait
subtasks.description: Define OutputRouter trait for routing a single output stream to multiple nodes

subtasks.title: Router implementations (RoundRobin, Broadcast, KeyBased, Merge)
subtasks.description: Implement router types: RoundRobin, Broadcast, KeyBased, and Merge as specified in GRAPH.md

tasks.title: Phase 3: Graph Builder API
tasks.description: Implement the fluent graph builder API with compile-time connection validation, port name resolution, and a state machine that tracks nodes and connections.
tasks.details: This phase provides the ergonomic API for constructing graphs. It includes a builder state machine, fluent builder methods, compile-time connection validation, and port name resolution.
tasks.testStrategy: Unit tests for builder API, compile-time validation tests, examples demonstrating fluent API usage

subtasks.title: Builder state machine
subtasks.description: Implement state machine using PhantomData to track graph construction state at compile time

subtasks.title: Fluent builder API
subtasks.description: Implement fluent methods for adding nodes with named ports and connecting ports by name

subtasks.title: Compile-time connection validation
subtasks.description: Implement compile-time validation of port connections using trait bounds and type-level checks

subtasks.title: Port name resolution
subtasks.description: Implement port name resolution system that maps string names to type-level ports

tasks.title: Phase 4: Graph Execution Engine
tasks.description: Implement the graph execution engine with concurrent node execution, stream routing via bounded channels, error handling, backpressure management, and lifecycle management.
tasks.details: This phase enables running the constructed graphs. It includes concurrent node execution, stream routing via bounded channels, error handling strategies, backpressure management, and lifecycle management (start, stop, pause).
tasks.testStrategy: Integration tests for graph execution, property-based tests for concurrent behavior, stress tests for backpressure

subtasks.title: Graph execution engine
subtasks.description: Implement core execution engine that spawns tasks for each node and manages their lifecycle

subtasks.title: Runtime management
subtasks.description: Implement runtime management for starting, stopping, pausing, and resuming graph execution

subtasks.title: Stream routing via bounded channels
subtasks.description: Implement stream routing between nodes using bounded channels with backpressure support

subtasks.title: Lifecycle management
subtasks.description: Implement lifecycle management including graceful shutdown, error propagation, and resource cleanup

tasks.title: Phase 5: Advanced Features
tasks.description: Implement advanced graph features including subgraph support (graph as a node), stateful processing nodes, and windowing operations with graph topology.
tasks.details: These features enable complex graph patterns. Subgraphs allow graphs to be used as nodes in other graphs. Stateful nodes maintain state across items. Windowing operations work with graph topology.
tasks.testStrategy: Integration tests for subgraphs, unit tests for stateful nodes, property-based tests for windowing

subtasks.title: Subgraph support
subtasks.description: Implement subgraph support allowing a graph to be used as a node in another graph

subtasks.title: Stateful nodes
subtasks.description: Implement stateful processing nodes that maintain state across stream items

subtasks.title: Windowing operations
subtasks.description: Implement windowing operations that work with graph topology for time-based and count-based windows

tasks.title: Phase 6: Integration and Testing
tasks.description: Integrate the graph module into lib.rs, add comprehensive tests, create examples, update documentation, and provide a migration guide from linear to graph API.
tasks.details: This phase completes the implementation by integrating everything, adding comprehensive tests, creating examples demonstrating various graph topologies, updating documentation, and providing migration guidance.
tasks.testStrategy: Comprehensive test suite including unit, integration, and property-based tests. Examples demonstrating various graph patterns.

subtasks.title: Module integration
subtasks.description: Integrate graph module into lib.rs, expose public API, ensure coexistence with linear pipeline API

subtasks.title: Tests
subtasks.description: Add comprehensive tests: unit tests for all components, integration tests for graph execution, property-based tests for type validation

subtasks.title: Examples
subtasks.description: Create examples demonstrating various graph topologies: simple linear, fan-out, fan-in, complex topologies, subgraphs

subtasks.title: Documentation
subtasks.description: Update documentation including API docs, architecture docs, migration guide from linear to graph API, and usage examples
